choices.A: Enable all 5-GHz channels that are supported by the region and use 40-MHz channels.
choices.C: Enable UNII-1 channels only and use 20-MHz channels.
choices.D: Enable all 5-GHz channels that are supported by the region and use 20-MHz channels.
choices.B: Enable UNII-1 channels only and use 80-MHz channels.

questions.question_text: A customer deploys a new Cisco high-density wireless network within the open areas of a mall to provide free public wireless on 5 GHz. The existing mall tenants have their own wireless networks that are independently managed. Which design approach minimizes channel utilization for the public network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D makes more sense. More channels - less possible CCI.

Selected Answer: D
We have to use all 5GHz channels that we can. With the smaller bandwith, 20 MHz. In order to acomodate high density mall requirements.

choices.A: Use EoIP for communication between controllers.
choices.E: Use secure mobility to pair controllers.
choices.C: Use AVC on the anchor WLCs.
choices.D: Use IPv6 across the wireless network.
choices.B: Use WLC software versions that support IRCM.

questions.question_text:
A new wireless network design has these requirements:
• AireOS WLCs as guest anchors
• a Cisco Catalyst 9800 Series WLC as the foreign controller
• use of Wi-Fi 6 APs
• inter-controller roaming for guest users

Which two design approaches meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Types of Tunnel
• Secure - The Catalyst 9800 controllers or the 9800 and AireOS (IRCM image) controllers use Control tunnel 16666 for Mobility Control messages and Data tunnel 16667 for Mobility Data Messages . This secure link is called Secure Mobility Tunnel.

• EOIP - Controllers (AireOS to AireOS or AireOS (IRCM image) to AireOS (old) ) within a mobility group communicate among themselves over a well-known UDP port 16666, and exchange data traffic through an Ethernet-over-IP (EoIP) tunnel. This is an unencrytpted connection

Selected Answer: BE
when using a mix of 9800 and AireOS for mobility/anchoring, secure mobility is used. EoIP will be used only between two AireOS.

Selected Answer: AB
I think it's A + B
Any comment here

comments.content: Can't be A either as communication between controllers uses UDP. Data between them uses EoIP.

As far as I can tell E = wrong as it is related to controllers comm
unication in a mobility group.

questions.question_text: An engineer is designing a new wireless network. Based on the design, OfficeExtend AP functionality must be used. Which type of license must the Cisco 5520 WLC v8.3 have?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
o use Cisco OEAPs, a base license must be installed and in use on the Cisco WLC. After the license is installed, you can enable the OfficeExtend mode on the supported Cisco Aironet AP models that support OfficeExtend mode.

Selected Answer: A
Given answer is correct -
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-3/config-guide/b_cg83/b_cg83_chapter_0110000.html

Selected Answer: CE
Given answer is correct. AP groups, group APs together by location and inside the AP group you can assign an RF profile that controls things like RRM.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-5/config-guide/b_cg85/configuring_ap_groups.html

questions.question_text: An engineer is trying to configure the APs installed in a new auditorium to use 40 MHz channels with high data rates and lower TX power. The APs in the building hallway must use lower-density design settings configured for the rest of the building. Which two configurations achieve this design? (Choose two.)

A Cisco controller-based wireless network must support workgroup bridges. The APs configured as workgroup bridges must support wired and wireless clients. The wireless clients must connect to the spare radio. What is the maximum number of wired client connections supported on a workgroup bridge?
